title: A 44% tariff on Sri Lanka? That’s not just wrong, it is bad economics
byline: The Trump administration’s move to slap a 44% tariff on Sri Lankan exports, currently on pause, but not off the table is a textbook example of policy driven by headline numbers, not economic reality.

title: Shots fired to quell inmate clash at Matara Prison
byline: Prison officials were forced to fire warning shots into the air to control a clash between two groups of inmates at the Matara Prison.

title: Health Ministry taking steps to increase facilities in hospitals
byline: Amidst rise in Chikungunya cases in Sri Lanka, Health Minister Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa said yesterday the Epidemiology Unit is on alert and the Health Ministry is making an intervention regarding the matter.

title: Dan Priyasad dies after shooting
byline: Social activist Dan Priyasad, who had been receiving treatment in the Intensive Care Unit (ICU) of the Colombo National Hospital, died last night.

title: India’s consent required to disclose MoUs - Cabinet Spokesman
byline: The government will present in Parliament all seven memoranda of understanding signed with India recently and that it will take some time as consent of both parties are needed to reveal some of the information, Cabinet Spokesman Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa said yesterday.

title: Former England star Flintoff reveals mental battle after car crash
byline: Former England star Andrew Flintoff has revealed the extent of the mental health struggles he has endured since his horrific car crash on the set of television programme Top Gear.

title: Cops make U-Turn on Dan Priyasad - First dead, now alive
byline: Police now say that social activist Dan Priyasad, who was shot in front of his residence at the ‘Laksanda Sevana’ apartment complex in Meetotamulla, is not dead but is currently receiving treatment in the Intensive Care Unit (ICU) in critical condition.

title: Sri Lanka’s economic growth  set to slow to 3.5% in 2025 amid structural and global Challenges
byline: Sri Lanka’s economic growth is projected to decelerate to 3.5 percent in 2025, according to the World Bank (WB), as the country contends with persistent structural constraints, global economic pressures, and unresolved trade policy uncertainties.

title: Resurgence of Malaria in Sri Lanka linked to overseas returnees
byline: Health officials warn that Malaria is on the rise again in Sri Lanka and it has been traced to individuals who have recently returned from abroad, Health Promotion Bureau.

title: All inmates of Matara prison transferred to Angunakolapelessa
byline: Following the clash between two groups of inmates at the Matara Prison,  all inmates of the Matara Prison are currently being transferred to the Angunakolapelessa prisons, the Prisons Department spokesman said.

title: Ten million registered for TIN, 7 million still unregistered: IRD
byline: A total of 10 million people have registered with the Inland Revenue Department to obtain Taxpayer Identification Numbers (TIN), while at least 7 million people still remain unregistered, IRD Deputy Commissioner General B.K.S. Shantha said.

title: Fallen tree damages seven vehicles in Borella
byline: Seven vehicles were damaged when a tree fell near the Kanatta Cemetery Roundaout in Borella, police said.

title: There are popular cardinals who could be Pope but the will of God will prevail: Fr. Jude Krishantha
byline: There are a number of popular cardinals who could be Pope, but God’s will is going to prevail at the end of the day, National Catholic Mass Communications Director Fr. Jude Krishantha said today.

title: Will the next Pope be from Africa?
byline: If the sole predictor of who would become the next Pope was where the Catholic Church is growing fastest, then it is almost certain he would hail from Africa.

title: Musk to reduce Doge role after Tesla profits plunge
byline: Tesla boss Elon Musk says he will cut back his role in Donald Trump’s administration after the company’s profits and revenues plunged during the first three months of the year.

title: Cardinal Malcolm Ranjith leaves for Rome
byline: Archbishop of Colombo, Cardinal Malcolm Ranjith, departed from the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) today for Italy to attend the funeral of the late Pope Francis in Rome, the Airport Officer in Charge confirmed.

title: UAE to prioritize energy, tourism, investment ties with Sri Lanka
byline: The United Arab Emirates (UAE) yesterday announced its commitment to prioritizing the promotion of the energy, tourism, foreign investment, and foreign employment sectors while further strengthening its longstanding ties with Sri Lanka.

title: No Russian charter flights to Sri Lanka until October
byline: Sri Lanka will not host Russian charter flights during the off-season due to diminished demand and a lack of summer promotions, according to the Association of Tour Operators of Russia (ATOR).

title: Lanka IOC reports subdued performance
byline: Lanka IOC PLC kicked off the March earnings season by reporting some subdued top and bottom-line performance for the 4Q25 period.

title: Shani Abeysekara appointed to committee probing Easter attack report
byline: Senior Superintendent of Police Shani Abeysekara has been appointed to the committee investigating the Presidential Commission of Inquiry report on the Easter Sunday terrorist attacks.

title: Travel bans imposed on father, son suspects in murder of Dan Priyasad
byline: Colombo Additional Magistrate Harshana Kakunawela today issued an order preventing two suspects, a father and son, from leaving the country in connection with the murder of Dan Priyasad in the Wellampitiya area.

title: Sajith condemns terror attack in Jammu Kashmir
byline: Opposition Leader Sajith Premadasa today condemned the terror attack in Jammu Kashmir where a gunmen killed 23 tourists

title: Pope Francis’ body lies in state for 3 days of public viewing at St. Peter’s Basilica ahead of funeral
byline: The body of Pope Francis is lying in state in St. Peter’s Basilica, where it will remain for three days until his funeral Saturday, expected to be attended by world leaders including US President Donald Trump.

title: SLCERT warn in cyber related cases
byline: A total of 2,500 cyber related incidents have been reported so far this year, according to the Sri Lanka Computer Emergency Readiness Team (SLCERT).

title: SL, US to make joint statement on reciprocal tariffs: President
byline: Claiming that the discussions between the Sri Lankan delegation and the US government on reciprocal tariffs were fruitful, President Anura Kumara Dissanayake said today that Sri Lanka and the United States will make a joint statement shortly.

title: Train derailment delays all services on main line
byline: A train derailment at the Gampaha railway station on the main line has disrupted services, with only one of the two tracks currently in operation, the Railways Department said.

title: Avoid plans to visit Kandy for ‘Siri Dalada Wandanawa’ for next two days: Police
byline: Police advise people to refrain from arriving in Kandy tomorrow and the day after (24 and 25) to venerate and pay their respects to the Sacred Tooth Relic as more than 300,000 devotees have joined the queues by now.

title: Committee appointed to probe proposed removal of Deshabandu
byline: A high-level committee has been appointed to investigate the allegations of misconduct and abuse of power against Inspector General of Police (IGP) Deshabandu Tennakoon, according to official sources.

title: Zimbabwe win first Test against Bangladesh by three wickets
byline: Zimbabwe won the first of two Tests against the hosts Bangladesh by three wickets Wednesday, with pacer Blessing Muzarabani taking nine wickets in the game to secure a decisive win on the fourth day.

title: CAA continues to track overpriced bottled water sales
byline: The Consumer Affairs Authority (CAA) is continuing its island-wide raids to track down vendors selling bottled drinking water at prices above the approved rates.

title: CSE ends mixed as ASPI dips, but S&P SL20 holds slight gains
byline: The Colombo Stock Exchange(CSE) saw mixed performance midweek, with the broader market under slight pressure while blue-chip counters showed marginal resilience. Investor activity remained measured, as sentiment stayed neutral ahead of upcoming earnings disclosures and key global macro triggers.

title: Sri Lanka name strong squad for India, South Africa tri-nation series
byline: Sri Lanka have announced a 17-member squad for their upcoming tri-nation series against India and South Africa at home.

title: Man dies while waiting in Kandy queues to venerate Sacred Tooth Relic: Police
byline: A person died due to a suspected heart attack while waiting in queues in Kandy for several days to venerate the Sacred Tooth Relic at the Sri Dalada Maligawa, the Kandy police said.

title: No more favours in school admissions, report injustices, says Harini
byline: The time when politicians, state officials and principals took advantage of school admissions is over. If there is any injustice in the admission of children to schools, it should be reported to the Education Ministry, Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya said.

title: Govt. to continue school nutrition programme without interruption
byline: The government has taken a policy decision to continue, without interruption, the ’’School Nutrition Programme’’ aimed at reducing anemia among schoolchildren, which is being implemented with the assistance of the World Food Programme (WFP), President’s Secretary Dr. Nandika Sanath Kumanayake said.

title: BIA Customs thwarts attempt to smuggle in Rs.1.15 Mn worth cigarettes
byline: An attempt to smuggle in foreign cigarettes worth over Rs. 1.15 million by two local passengers returning from Dubai was thwarted by Sri Lanka Customs at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) this morning.

title: Venus, Saturn, Moon to appear together in sky on April 25
byline: People who enjoy watching the night sky will have a special sight to look forward to this week. In the early morning hours of April 25, 2025, Venus, Saturn and the Moon will appear close together in the sky, creating a beautiful conjunction that can be seen with the naked eye.

title: Former cricketer Malinda Warnapura ordained as pastor by Jerome Fernando
byline: Former Sri Lankan cricketer Malinda Warnapura has been appointed as pastor for New Zealand by Pastor Jerome Fernando.

title: Zimbabwe repeat 2018 heroics with thrilling Test win in Sylhet
byline: The visitors held their nerve to clinch a famous three-wicket win over Bangladesh that gave them a 1-0 advantage in the two-match series.
